questions.text: How much does Lacey charge for coffee?
questions.explanation:
$1.50

	Brent thinks that Lacey should offer him free refills since he's always coming in and having coffee, and he's disgusted to find that he has to pay $1.50 per cup.  He says that he could go and drink thirty cups of coffee over the whole morning, and that Tommy Douglas fought for free refills of coffee.  He actually fought for free healthcare.

questions.text: What does Brent always call the tax man?
questions.explanation:
Muffin Tray.

	When the tax man arrives looking for his father, Brent gets concerned and tries to prevent telling the man where he is.  In their conversation, Oscar ends up arriving and Brent tells him everything he needs to know.  It turns out that he only needs to check out some receipts from the previous year.The tax man's real name is Marvin Gray.

questions.text: The tax man called Oscar before driving to Dog River.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Oscar complains that the tax man never called rather than come to Dog River, but the truth is that Oscar did talk to him on the phone.  Oscar told Marvin to drive down because his tax dollars were paying for the call.

questions.text: Who does Oscar ask for help in getting rid of the tax man?
questions.explanation:
Hank.

	Oscar tells Hank that he'd be best suited for the job because he's like a weasel and he's shifty.  They decide to talk about their plans in the coffee shop, but during their conversation, they realize that Marvin is in the booth right behind them.

questions.text: What Al Pacino movie does Davis bring up while talking to Karen?
questions.explanation:
Serpico.

	Davis says that Karen broke the code by not sticking up for Davis when he had to pay for the coffees at The Ruby.  He tells Karen that she's Serpico and she goes to Brent to find out why.  Brent says that he can't remember the ending, but he says that either he was shot in the head, or he went blind.

True.

	Hank suggests to Oscar that they blackmail Marvin in order to get out of the situation, but he also has a Plan B.  The second plan ends up making no sense whatsoever, and they end up suggesting that Hank seduce Marvin as a joke.Meanwhile, Karen begs Lacey to give Davis free coffee so that she doesn't turn out like Serpico.

questions.text: What books did Emma throw away?
questions.explanation:
Garfield.

	Brent suggests that Oscar should go home and look for the receipts in order to straighten everything out and he decides it wouldn't hurt.  Emma wonders why he's rummaging through boxes, and she says that if he's looking for his Garfield books, she threw them out, and because of this, he gets angry.

questions.text: Where did Emma put the tax forms?
questions.explanation:
garage.

	Emma persistently asks Oscar if he needs help finding stuff and he tells her he can't find the tax forms.  When she tells him she put them in the garage, he denies that he was ever told about it.  In a flashback, it shows that she specifically told him where they were going, what colour box they would be in, and that he'd need them if the tax man would ever come.

questions.text: Who suggests that Lacey use the free coffees as a tax write-off?
questions.explanation:
Marvin.

	Lacey decides to do this plan in order to make Davis happy with Karen again, and to keep the peace in the town.  Brent decides to buy Marvin a beer in order to cheer him up and at the hotel, Hank and Oscar begin to initiate their plan to threaten Marvin with blackmail.

questions.text: Who gave Oscar the tax papers?
questions.explanation:
Emma.

	After Oscar continues to deny that Emma put the tax papers in the garage, he brings them to the hotel for him to give to the tax man.  Everything is straightened out, and Emma tells Brent that he was also told where the forms were; it was at the same time that she told Oscar.
